image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

props.synopsis: Rex Airlines, Australia's largest regional and domestic airline operator, enters administration with domestic 737 services grounded and Virgin Australia offering free rebooking.

title.children: Rex Airlines enters voluntary administration but regional routes continuing to operate

image.altText: Jess Fox smiles while walking through the crowd with an Australian flag draped over her shoulders

props.synopsis: Australia's James Willett is a strong chance of gold in the men's trap final, Jess Fox competes in the C1 event she won in Tokyo, while the Boomers lose to Canada in their Group A clash. Follow live.

title.children: James Willett shoots for Paris gold as Jess Fox returns to the rapids

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tennis: Coco Gauff is eliminated in the third round!
Shooting: Aussie James Willett into the Men's Trap final
Swimming: Australia qualifies for men's 4 x 200m freestyle relay final

image.altText: An image of Joanne Shanahan and Tania McNeill.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the road deaths of Joanne Shanahan and Tania McNeill will investigate whether police had prior opportunity to intervene before the fatal crash occurred in April 2020.

title.children: Cameras could not detect high-speed driver who later killed SA Police officer and mother, inquest hears

image.altText: A man with short dark hair wearing sunglasses and a blue spotty face mask

props.synopsis: A man who raped a woman with an intellectual disability in his care has been labelled a "predator" by a District Court judge and will remain behind bars until at least 2031.

title.children: 'She was believed': Judge lauded 'vulnerable' woman who reported disability worker for rape

image.altText: An apparent selfie of a woman in glasses.

props.synopsis: Murder accused Caroll Hopkinson "panicked" and was "in fear for her life" as she struggled over a knife with her husband who she was trying to save, a court hears.

title.children: Adelaide woman was acting in self-defence when husband was stabbed, court hears

image.altText: A police car and people outside a shopping centre complex.

props.synopsis: Management of Westfield Marion is facing calls to upskill and increase security at the Adelaide shopping complex after South Australia's workplace safety watchdog examined its response to last month's public disturbance.

title.children: Westfield handed improvement notices after fight triggers shopping centre evacuation

image.altText: A greens flyer reading Unf*** the Future

props.synopsis: A flyer authorised by the Australian Greens has created controversy for its deliberately bold and colourful language as SA party members say it blindsided them.

title.children: SA Greens distance themselves from 'Unf*** the future' flyer distributed in Adelaide

image.altText: Two female rugby players in Australian colours contest the ball against a rival player.

props.synopsis: Jason Levi and Andrew Goodman are from different states, but they have one very special thing in common — both are watching not one but two of their children representing Australia on the world stage.

title.children: Proud dads of Olympic siblings reflect on the road to Paris

image.altText: A girl with blonde hair holding a red football while wearing a red uniform in front of an oval

props.synopsis: Pippa Blackwell will represent South Australia at a national Australian rules competition, and wants to one day play for the Geelong Cats, but soon she will be too old to play with her local football club.

title.children: Pippa dreams of playing in the AFLW but soon she won't even be able to play local footy

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a dark blazer answers questions from a reporter in a corridor.

props.synopsis: As regional carrier Rex faces an uncertain future several Australian politicians take aim at Qantas but an industry expert says Rex only has itself to blame.

title.children: Qantas has 'enacted retribution' on Rex Airlines, says Shadow transport minister

image.altText: A young woman holding a black and white photo of her mother.

props.synopsis: Romany Wake and Shakira Robertson used to be next door neighbours. Now they're trying to support each other after both their mothers were killed tragically in separate incidents.

title.children: 'I've just killed your mum': Romany Wake's father committed murder, then told her to call triple-0

image.altText: a young woman with brown hair down to her shoulders in shorts and tank top perched on a large rock in a rainforest

props.synopsis: For many Australians, completing an online registration or ticking a box on their licence renewal is the most thought given to organ donation. But for donation specialists — who support donors' families — it is part of day-to-day life.

title.children: Ten years on from a double lung transplant, Jess is honouring her donor's wish for more adventures

image.altText: Constable Randall Kirk walking in front of two other men wearing a blazer with a police name badge pinned onto it and glasses.

props.synopsis: Footage from Constable Randall Kirk's body worn camera shows him hiding behind a tree and running to the police car to escape the property at Wieambilla.

title.children: Officer's body worn footage shows moment he ran as shots fired at Wieambilla

image.altText: Kamala Harris, in a beige suite, looks over her shoulders at the top of aircraft stairs

props.synopsis: North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper and Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer are both out of the race to become Kamala Harris's running mate.

title.children: Kamala Harris running mate race narrows, with two more candidates out

image.altText: An aerial shot shows mourners from the Druze minority surrounding five white coffins.

props.synopsis: Israel promised to make Hezbollah pay for the strike in Majdal Shams, but as the war in Gaza drags on it finds itself in a tough position.

title.children: Israel thought two unusual security strategies kept it safe. Here's why they may no longer work

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: New data issued by the Australian Bureau of Statistics show the total number of dwellings approved in June fell by 6.5 per cent. Some experts are calling on Australia to adopt more alternative construction models.

title.children: Construction body says Australia will struggle to build 1.2 million new homes if building approvals don't improve

image.altText: A police officer carrying a bunch of flowers looks down

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift pays tribute to the children killed and injured in a stabbing attack at a dance class being held to her music on Monday, saying she's "completely in shock", as the death toll from the incident rises.

title.children: 'Completely in shock': Taylor Swift pays tribute to children killed in UK stabbing attack at dance class as death toll rises

image.altText: An aurora visible on the horizon, over water.

props.synopsis: The stunning weather event that delighted stargazers around the world returns to Australian skies, with the geomagnetic storm expected to be at its strongest on Tuesday evening but lasting for several days.

title.children: Aurora australis lights up the sky as BOM forecasts significant geomagnetic activity

image.altText: A swimmer looks on during a training session

props.synopsis: Lani Pallister, who was regarded as a genuine chance of claiming a medal in the 1,500m freestyle, has withdrawn from the event after testing positive to COVID.

title.children: Lani Pallister withdraws from 1,500m freestyle after testing positive to COVID

image.altText: Four men and a woman pose in an aquatics centre.

props.synopsis: Bob Ballard says he is sorry if his comment on the Australian women swim team, which was criticised for being sexist, caused offence to some people.

title.children: Commentator responds after removal from Olympics over gendered comment on Australian swimmers

image.altText: A firefighter silhouetted against a wall of flame by the side of the road

props.synopsis: The fire sparked by the car is now the sixth largest wildfire in Californian history, across more than 149,000 hectares and only 12 per cent contained.

title.children: California is facing one of the biggest fires in its history. Investigators say one man is responsible

image.altText: Sinead O'Connor wearing a black suit, golden cross necklace, and priest's collar while holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: Shortly after the one-year anniversary of Sinéad O'Connor's death at age 56, an Irish newspaper is reporting a death certificate reveals the singer died from chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and bronchial asthma.

title.children: More details about Sinéad O'Connor's cause of death revealed

image.altText: A woman holds her arm to her forehead while laying on a bed.

props.synopsis: Australian women with menopause are leaving the workforce early over a lack of support, Australian unions tell a Senate inquiry into menopause and perimenopause. They're calling for 10 days paid leave to help keep them at work.

title.children: Australian unions call for 10 days paid reproductive leave to support women with menopause

image.altText: Clare Looker appears serious, standing in front of an artwork at a press conference.

props.synopsis: An outbreak of Legionnaires' disease in metropolitan Melbourne has continued to grow, as health authorities race to find the source of infection.

title.children: Melbourne Legionnaires' disease mystery outbreak swells to at least 33

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings for day four of the Olympic Games

image.altText: Tahiti

props.synopsis: It has broken the record for an Olympic venue being the longest distance away from a host city, and Teahupo'o is providing a spectacular backdrop to one of the newest events at the Games.

title.children: Cruise ship accommodation and the 'pile of skulls' — the Olympics surfing venue is one of the most unique in history

image.altText: Collingwood CEO Craig Kelly.

props.synopsis: The Collingwood Football Club is facing new allegations of racism, with its chief executive officer Craig Kelly accused of making slurs and jokes about Indigenous culture.

title.children: Collingwood Football Club taken to court over racial discrimination allegations

image.altText: Ryan Murphy hugs his wife in the stands. She holds a sign reading "Ryan It's A Girl"

props.synopsis: That's the surprise message that American swimmer Ryan Murphy got from the pool deck as he looked up at his wife in the stands at the Paris Olympics.

title.children: 'It's a girl!' Olympian discovers gender of unborn child while standing on Paris podium

image.altText: Simone leans over onto the beam and has a look of immense concentration, wearing a blue and red US leotard.

props.synopsis: She's the most decorated gymnast of all time — but even Simone Biles has fallen victim to this little-known mental block.

title.children: How Simone Biles overcame 'the twisties' to compete for Olympic gold

image.altText: A woman and a teenage girl smiling.

props.synopsis: Emma Kuveya's quick thinking to grab an unconscious bus driver's foot off the accelerator has been recognised with an award.

title.children: When Emma's school bus driver had a heart attack, she took the wheel

image.altText: A woman runs past a police barricade with a fire lit in front

props.synopsis: Demonstrators are protesting outside the presidential palace and toppling down statues following the re-election of Venezuela's president Nicolás Maduro. Here's your breakdown.

title.children: 'We're fed up': Why deadly protests are erupting in Venezuela following the country's election

image.altText: James O'Brien smiles while standing in front of a sandy beach in Sydney. He's holding crutches and wearing his prosthetic leg.

props.synopsis: A year since my amputation, I'm marking my "stumpiversary" (as it's sometimes called in the amputee community) and I'm feeling both optimistic and reflective.

title.children: A year ago I became an amputee. Here's how my life has changed

image.altText: Young smiling woman with long dark hair pulled back, holding a baby, whose face is blurred. both wearing brown, mustard clothes

props.synopsis: A murder trial centred around Amber Haigh's sudden disappearance from regional New South Wales more than two decades ago was played grainy footage of detectives finding a note tucked away in a bright-green cabinet.

title.children: Amber Haigh murder trial sees grainy footage of police finding 'suicide note'

image.altText: Two men in rain jackets, walk with a woman who is carrying a child through the mud.

props.synopsis: Local authorities say rescue operations have been hampered after a main bridge collapsed in the region.

title.children: Multiple landslides in India's Kerala state kill at least 93 and injure over 70 with hundreds missing

image.altText: Paul Dietze

props.synopsis: As dangerous new opioids arrive on Australian streets, experts are calling for more frontline workers to be issued with naloxone, a medicine that can halt drug overdoses.

title.children: Calls for more frontline workers to be armed with drug-overdose-fighting medicine
